SEARCH
Package gw.api.util

Class DuplicateSearchHelper

java.lang.Object
gw.api.util.DuplicateSearchHelper
public class DuplicateSearchHelper extends Object
Utility class to assist the construction of SQL when searching for duplicates. This class is the replacement for com.guidewire.cc.domain.duplicatesearch.VelocityUtil which was used to provide resources for duplicate searches in versions prior to ClaimCenter 6.0.

  • Constructor Details

    • DuplicateSearchHelper

      public DuplicateSearchHelper()

  • Method Details

    • makeParam

      public String makeParam(Object value)
      Returns the SQL symbol '?' and saves the value in a list to be given as parameters to the SQL prepared statement. This version of makeParam cannot be used with a null value as the type of the parameter cannot be deduced from a null value. To pass a null value use makeParam with a beanpath of property info parameter
      Parameters:
      value - the value to convert into a parameter
      Returns:
      the string "?"

    • makeParam

      public String makeParam(String beanPath, Object value)
      Returns the SQL symbol '?' and saves the value in a list to be given as parameters to the SQL prepared statement.
      Parameters:
      beanPath - the column-path to which this value belongs, this help resolve the type of the value involved. For example, if passing a policy number as the value the the path Policy.PolicyNumber would be used to indicate that the value is the same type as the PolicyNumber field in the Policy type. The path must resolve to a property that corresponds to an actual database column.
      value - the value to convert into a parameter
      Returns:
      the string "?"

    • makeParam

      public String makeParam(IEntityPropertyInfo propertyInfo, Object value)
      Returns the SQL symbol '?' and saves the value in a list to be given as parameters to the SQL prepared statement.
      Parameters:
      propertyInfo - the property info corresponding to the value, used to determine the type of the value
      value - the value to convert into a parameter
      Returns:
      the string "?"

    • getTypeCodeId

      public Integer getTypeCodeId(TypeKey typeCode)
      Gets the ID for the typecode identified by the given type code
      Parameters:
      typeCode - the type code
      Returns:
      the integer key for the given type code

    • escapeSqlString

      public String escapeSqlString(String str)
      Escapes all occurences of single quote (') by preceding them with an additional single quote; (') becomes (''). Does not surround the entire string with single quotes.
      Parameters:
      str - the string to be escaped, must not be null
      Returns:
      the escaped string

    • getSQLStringValue

      public String getSQLStringValue(Object value)
      Returns the SQL string equivalent for the value passed in. For example a simple string will be wrapped in single quotes and escaped. A date will be converted into the appropriate form for the current database etc.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to convert, can be null
      Returns:
      the value converted to a SQL string, or "NULL" if the value was null

    • compareIfEqualTo

      public String compareIfEqualTo(Object value)
      If value is null returns "is null" otherwise returns "= sqlValue" where sqlValue is the result of calling getSQLStringValue(Object) on value. Useful for constructing SQL expressions of the form field = value where value may be null. Can be called from Velocity
      Parameters:
      value - the value we want to compare for equality
      Returns:
      "is null" or "= sqlValue", where sqlValue is the value converted to a SQL string

    • compareIfEqualToLowerCase

      public String compareIfEqualToLowerCase(Object value)
      If value is a String returns compareIfEqual(((String) value).toLoserCase()) otherwise compareIfEqualTo(value). Useful for constructing SQL expressions of the form field = value.toLowerCase() where the field is a lower case denorm field and value may be null. Can be called from Velocity
      Parameters:
      value - the value we want to compare for equality
      Returns:
      "is null" or "= sqlValue", where sqlValue is the value converted to a SQL string and lower cased if the original value was a string

    • format

      public String format(String input, Object[] args)
      Behaves identical to Java's MessageFormat.format() except that more than 10 arguements are allowed.
      NOTE: params must appear in input string in the order that they're numbered, starting with 0; for exampple, {1} can't come before {0}.
      Parameters:
      input - String where arguement placeholds are replaced. An arguement placeholder is the arguement # surrounded by curly braces. ex: "{0} is the first arguement, {1} is the second arguement"
      args - Objects with which to replace the arguement placeholders
      Returns:
      Input string with all the agruements populated by the objects
      See Also:
      • MessageFormat.format(String, Object[])

    • prettyPrintSQL

      public String prettyPrintSQL(String sql, boolean html)
      Utility to pretty print SQL. Only for use in debugging/loggiing and code should never rely on the exact format of the SQL.
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL to be format
      html - format as HTML (if false, plain text)
      Returns:
      pretty printed SQL
